name: Vail
description: Vail is the largest ski resort in Colorado with world-class terrain and amenities.

name: Aspen Snowmass
description: Four mountains in one with upscale amenities and diverse terrain for all levels.

name: Park City
description: The largest ski resort in the United States with over 7,300 acres of terrain.

name: Whistler Blackcomb
description: North America's largest ski resort with epic snow and year-round mountain activities.

name: Breckenridge
description: Historic mining town with above-treeline skiing and vibrant après-ski scene.

name: Jackson Hole
description: Legendary steep terrain and challenging runs for advanced skiers.

name: Alta
description: Skiers-only resort famous for its deep powder and no-frills atmosphere.

name: Mammoth Mountain
description: California's premier ski destination with the longest season and consistent snowfall.

name: Killington
description: The Beast of the East with extensive terrain and the longest season in the East.

name: Big Sky Resort
description: Montana's biggest resort with vast terrain and no lift lines.

name: Heavenly
description: Stunning Lake Tahoe views with terrain spanning California and Nevada.

name: Steamboat
description: Champagne powder and authentic Western ski town atmosphere.

name: Deer Valley
description: Luxury skiers-only resort with impeccable grooming and five-star service.

name: Squaw Valley Alpine Meadows
description: Historic Olympic venue with diverse terrain and Lake Tahoe beauty.

name: Copper Mountain
description: Naturally divided terrain perfect for all ability levels.

name: Keystone
description: Family-friendly resort with the most night skiing in Colorado.

name: Telluride
description: Remote mountain town with challenging terrain and stunning San Juan views.

name: Taos Ski Valley
description: Southwestern charm with steep terrain and deep cultural roots.

name: Snowbird
description: Utah powder paradise with challenging terrain and a famous tram.

name: Sun Valley
description: America's first destination ski resort with legendary grooming and sophistication.

name: Winter Park
description: Colorado's favorite with varied terrain and easy access from Denver.

name: Stowe
description: Classic Vermont skiing with picturesque village and New England charm.

name: Alyeska
description: Alaska's premier resort with ocean views and incredible snowfall.

name: Mt. Bachelor
description: Oregon's largest resort with 360-degree skiing on a volcanic peak.

name: Banff Sunshine
description: Canadian Rockies beauty with long season and powder-filled bowls.

name: Lake Louise
description: Iconic Canadian resort with breathtaking scenery and diverse terrain.

name: Tremblant
description: European-style village with Eastern Canada's best vertical.

name: Revelstoke
description: North America's greatest vertical with legendary powder and terrain.

name: Sunday River
description: Maine's premier resort with eight interconnected peaks.

name: Loveland
description: Independent Colorado resort with high elevation and great snow.

name: Sugarbush
description: Classic Vermont resort with challenging terrain and Mad River Valley views.

name: Crested Butte
description: Remote mountain town with extreme terrain and old-school Colorado vibe.

name: Chamonix Mont-Blanc
description: Legendary alpine resort at the foot of Mont Blanc with world-class off-piste terrain.

name: Zermatt
description: Year-round skiing beneath the iconic Matterhorn with glacier terrain.

name: St. Anton am Arlberg
description: Cradle of alpine skiing with legendary après-ski and challenging terrain.

name: Cortina d'Ampezzo
description: Glamorous Italian resort in the stunning Dolomites, host of 2026 Olympics.

name: Verbier
description: Swiss Alps playground with extensive off-piste and vibrant nightlife.

name: Val d'Isère
description: Premier French resort with snow-sure skiing and Olympic heritage.

name: Kitzbühel
description: Historic Austrian town with legendary Hahnenkamm downhill race.

name: Courchevel
description: Luxurious French resort in the massive Trois Vallées ski area.

name: Ischgl
description: Austrian party town with modern lifts and extensive groomed runs.

name: Tignes
description: High-altitude glacier skiing with year-round snow and modern facilities.

name: Saas-Fee
description: Car-free village with glacier skiing and stunning mountain panoramas.

name: Sölden
description: Austrian glacier resort with two peaks over 3000m and year-round skiing.

name: Méribel
description: Heart of Trois Vallées with traditional chalet architecture and British charm.

name: Engelberg
description: Swiss resort with massive vertical and rotating cable car access to glaciers.

name: La Plagne
description: Massive French ski area connected to Les Arcs in the Paradiski domain.

name: Andermatt
description: Historic Swiss village with modern resort development and reliable snow.

name: Alpe d'Huez
description: Sunny French resort with 300 days of sunshine and legendary Sarenne run.

name: Livigno
description: Duty-free Italian resort with reliable snow and modern lift system.

name: Åre
description: Sweden's largest ski resort with World Cup pedigree and long season.

name: Lech-Zürs
description: Exclusive Austrian resort with legendary snow quality and upscale ambiance.

name: Cervinia
description: High-altitude Italian resort connected to Zermatt with glacier skiing.

name: Grandvalira
description: Andorra's largest ski area with duty-free shopping and sunny slopes.

name: Garmisch-Partenkirchen
description: Historic German resort at the base of the Zugspitze, Germany's highest peak.

name: Saalbach-Hinterglemm
description: Austrian party resort with extensive ski circus and legendary après-ski.

name: Les Deux Alpes
description: French glacier resort with summer skiing and vibrant village atmosphere.

name: Madonna di Campiglio
description: Elegant Italian resort in the Brenta Dolomites with World Cup racing.

name: Davos
description: Historic Swiss resort town with extensive skiing and famous Parsenn runs.

name: Val Thorens
description: Europe's highest ski resort with guaranteed snow in Trois Vallées.

name: Hemsedal
description: Norway's premier ski destination with reliable snow and modern facilities.

name: Avoriaz
description: Car-free French resort in Portes du Soleil with futuristic architecture.

name: Trysil
description: Norway's largest ski resort with family-friendly slopes and northern lights.

name: Les Arcs
description: French resort linked to La Plagne in the Paradiski area with stunning views.

name: Granite Peak
description: Wisconsin's tallest ski area with the most vertical in the Midwest.

name: Boyne Mountain
description: Northern Michigan resort with family-friendly terrain and year-round activities.

name: Lutsen Mountains
description: Minnesota's largest ski area on the North Shore of Lake Superior.

name: Nub's Nob
description: Northern Michigan's premier ski resort with excellent grooming and snowmaking.

name: Wilmot Mountain
description: Convenient skiing near Chicago with extensive night skiing and terrain parks.

name: Valle Nevado
description: Chile's largest ski resort near Santiago with modern facilities and reliable snow.

name: Portillo
description: Legendary Chilean resort with stunning Andes views and world-class steep terrain.

name: Cerro Catedral
description: Argentina's largest ski resort near Bariloche with stunning lake and mountain views.

name: Las Leñas
description: Argentina's premier high-altitude resort with long runs and deep powder.

name: Chapelco
description: Patagonian ski resort near San Martín de los Andes with tree skiing and lake views.

name: La Parva
description: Chilean resort connected to Valle Nevado with stunning Santiago views.

name: Cerro Castor
description: World's southernmost ski resort in Tierra del Fuego with long season.

name: El Colorado
description: Historic Chilean resort near Santiago with family-friendly terrain.

name: Arizona Snowbowl
description: Arizona's premier ski resort on the San Francisco Peaks near Flagstaff with stunning views.
